documents.semantic_identifier: 2.9 Governance of climate change mitigation and adaptation | 2. Climate change | Europe's environment 2025 (EEA)
documents.blurb:
It is also necessary to increase the timeliness and quality of plans, addressing the ambition gaps (i.e. Member States targets/contributions not achieving EU-wide targets) and public participation as well as reduce administrative burdens .
The 2021 Adaptation Strategy outlines a vision of a climate-resilient EU society by 2050 . The European Climate Law requires Member States and the EU to enhance their adaptive capacity, strengthen their resilience and reduce their vulnerability to climate change .
match_highlights:
and ensure evidence-based decision-making in climate policy formulation and implementation.

documents.semantic_identifier: Climate change: overview | 2. Climate change | Europe's environment 2025 (EEA)
documents.blurb:
Justice aspects in sustainability transitions are more broadly discussed in briefing 4.11 Justice in sustainability transitions .
2.8 Climate action financing
This briefing covers the scale of investments in climate action to date and considers what investments are still needed (public and private) to achieve the EU climate change targets (with sums converted into constant values based on 2024 (EUR 2024 ) to account for changing values over different years). It is possible that certain investments included here will also contribute to other environmental objectives.
match_highlights:
covered in briefing 2.6 Climate risks to the economy and the EU sustainable finance agenda is covered in briefing 4.12 Financing the transition towards sustainable activities .
